ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:0.5_0: 8. The training rule on what is set aside
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.2_0: At that time a certain man said to his wife,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.3_0: “I“ll give a robe to Venerable Upananda.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.4_0: An alms-collecting monk heard that man speaking those words.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.5_1: They went to Upananda and said,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.7_0: In such-and-such a place I heard a man telling his wife
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.8_0: that’s just what I was thinking.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.10_0: Upananda then went to that man,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.11_0: “Is it true that you desire to give me a robe?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.12_0: “Well, gentlemen, it occur to me that
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.13_0: that’s just what I was thinking.”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.14_0: “If that’s the case, give me such-and-such a robe.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.15_0: For what’s the point of giving robes that I won’t use?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.16_0: That man complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.17_0: “These Sakyan ascetics have great desires; they’re not content.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.18_0: It’s no easy matter to give them robe-cloth.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.19_0: How can Venerable Upananda come to me and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited by me?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.20_0: The monks heard the complaints of that man,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.21_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.22_0: “How can Venerable Upananda approach a householder and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.23_0: After rebuking him in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned the monks:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.24_0: “Is it true, Upananda, that you acted like this?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.28_0: “Foolish man, people who are not related don’t know what’s appropriate and what’s inappropriate in dealing with each other, what’s right and what’s wrong.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.29_0: And still you went to an unrelated householder and specified the kind of robe you wanted without first being invited.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.30_0: Foolish man, this won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.31_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.32.1_0: ‘If a male or female householder has set aside a robe fund for an unrelated monk, thinking,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.33_0: ‘With this robe fund I will buy a robe and give it to monk so-and-so;’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.34_0: and specify the kind of robe he wants without first being invited,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.35_0: ‘It would be good if you would use this robe fund to buy such-and-such a robe and then give it to me,’
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:1.1.36_0: if a monk desires, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.2_0: for the benefit of a monk; making a monk the object, he wishes to give to the monk.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.4_0: ’s mother’s side, of pure descent, irrefutable and impeccable in questions of ancestry back to the seventh paternal generation.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.10_0: money, gold, a pearl, a gem, a coral, a crystal, cloth, thread, or cotton wool.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.12_0: that which is at one’s disposal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.18_0: the monk for whom the robe fund has been set aside.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.20_0: he or she has not said beforehand: “Venerable, what kind of robe do you need? What kind of robe can I buy for you?”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.22_0: where he went to his house and fear.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.24_0: May the wind not blow or the gentle,
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.26_0: that which is at one’s disposal.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.28_0: Living in a pit, a gentle, or soft.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.33_0: Because of her wanting to see her:
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.35_0: If that lay person buys a robe that is long, wide, closely woven, or soft because of the monk’s statement, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.36_0: When he gets the sitting-blanket, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.37_0: It should be relinquished to a sangha, a group, or an individual.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.38_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.40_0: ‘Venerables, this robe which I received after approaching an unrelated householder and specifying the kind of robe I wanted without first being invited is to be relinquished.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.41_0: I relinquish them to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.1.44_0: ‘I give these tonics back to you.’”
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.1_0: If the householder is unrelated and the monk perceives them as such, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.2_0: If the householder is unrelated, but the monk is unsure of it, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.3_0: If the householder is unrelated, but the monk perceives them as related, and, without first being invited, he approaches them and specifies the kind of robe he wants, he commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.4_0: If the person is related, but the monk perceives them as unrelated, commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.5_0: If the person is related, but the monk is unsure of it, commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.2.6_0: If the householders are related and he perceives them as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.3_0: if he asks those who have given an invitation;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.4_0: if he asks for the benefit of someone else;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.5_0: if it is by means of one’s own property;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.6_0: if the lay person wishes to buy something expensive, but the monk gets them to buy something inexpensive;
ai-pli-tv-bu-vb-np8:2.3.9_0: The eighth rule, the training rule on what is set aside, is finished.
